Author: Markus#5464
Content: @jl777c what is your thoughts on current market condition when it comes to bitcoin? does it make sense for this pump in price to sustain without correction?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: why not? the price was held steady <$4200 for a long time, such non-volatilty is not natural and indicates it is being suppressed or supported. Like back when it was supported at >$6000, then when the support was removed, it plunged and it never corrected back up other than the DCB (dead cat bounce)

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so why to expect it will pull back now?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: of course, it could all go to $1500 tomorrow if some lunatic sells 1 million BTC at market price

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: trying to predict day to day price... you need to improve your psychic skills

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: other than obvious acceleration/deceleration soon after trend changes, DCB and its reverse (not sure its name), there are few "sure things"

Author: Markus#5464
Content: But if we look at weekly stochastic it have been at max for quite some time, question is how long it will be possible to keep it there without resetting it

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: markets go a lot longer than you believe it can, they do until they dont

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you can see it change, but until it changes, you cant see it change

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: better to react to what the market is doing, than try to predict what it will do

Author: Markus#5464
Content: Ye true

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the best I got was 85% accuracy on a 2 hours ahead prediction

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but with all the spreads, commissions and slippage, it is not easy to convert even an 85% accurate up/down predictor into actual profits

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: sure you can make a lot more money by knowing the exact market top and bottom, but then again if you have such powers, just buy the winning lotto ticket

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the easy (and boring way) is to wait for market to change polarity and go all in

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so now we changed from bear to non-bear and the bull is not confirmed yet. Assuming you did the same on the bull peak when it changed from bull to not bull, I think around $10K price, then cost averaged out for an average of $10K (as it bounced about the $10K price for a while), then you now cost average back in around the $5K price. it is "only" a double and taking a few years to achieve, but it removes the chopped off fingers from trying to catch the falling prices

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: dont bother to try to predict the exact peak. just wait for it to be confirmed and then switch out over some relatively short period of time, like one to two months

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: since we are in about a 4 year cycle, maybe 4 months is ok time for the transition

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if you back test this over the last few cycles, i think it will show a very good performance, though far far from picking the exact top and bottom. Yes, you "sacrifice" the 50% of price movement that 100% accurate psychic powers would have gotten, but unless you have such psychic powers, those were funds you never had anyway.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: can you slam dunk a basketball with one hand on a 3 meter high hoop?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: does that make you sad?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: not being able to do the impossible, there is no shame in this. Accepting a mere doubling of capital every few years... with relatively low risk. The problem is that the tendency is to want to trade more, which will just cost you more in fees and likely you make bad trades anyway. Best to spend the time doing productive things
